div.p: Short description of the functional requirements.
Digest (or abstract) of the requirements documents.
Reference to complete requirements documents (incl. version identification and location).
A compact summary of the functional environment of the system. Answers the following questions (at least approximately):

ul.li: ·Why should the system exist? Why is the system valuable or important? Which problems does the system solve?

div.p: From the point of view of the end users a system is created or modified to improve execution of a business activity.
This essential architecture driver must not be neglected even though the quality of an architecture is mostly judged by its level of fulfillment of non-functional requirements.
Short textual description, probably in tabular use-case format.
The business context should in any case refer to the corresponding requirements documents.
Short descriptions of the most important:

ul.li: non-functional requirements and other constraints (the most important ones must be covered as architecture goals or are listed in the “Constraints” section), and/or

ac:rich-text-body.p: Here you can reuse parts of the requirements documents – but keep these excerpts short and balance readability against avoidance of redundancy
